Solid Community Survey Results

Introduction

In June 2021, the Solid Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Team (DEIT) launched the first official Solid Community Survey. As the Solid community continues to grow, we want to be able to include and support people of all backgrounds, industries, and identities. Through the survey, we wanted to learn about the members who comprise the community, discover issues people might be facing within the community, and how to make the community stronger, more welcoming, and ultimately, larger.

Research Plan

See the research plan here

Participants

  • The survey ran from June 10th until June 25th
  • There were 131 participants

Results

1. What country do you currently reside in?

Responses: 131

Top 3 Countries:

  1. United States - 28% (36 responses)
  2. Belgium - 13% (17 responses)
  3. United Kingdom - 12% (15 responses)

[Insert map chart here]

2. What languages do you speak or read?

Responses: 131

Everyone selected English (the survey was only was offered in English).

Top 3 Languages (Besides English):

  1. French - 37% (49 responses)
  2. German - 24% (32 responses)
  3. Spanish - 15% (20 responses)

Respondents who speak or read more than one language: 66% (86 responses)

3. What categories best describe you?

Responses: 119

  • 5 participants identified as more than one category

4. How do you describe your gender identity?

Responses: 117

5. What is your age?

Responses: 126

[Insert chart here]

6. What is the highest level of education you have completed?

Responses: 129

[Insert chart here]

7. How would you describe yourself?

  1. What industry or field are you in?
    – List of answers with number of responses (and percentages)

  2. Do you use any accessibility tools while using a computer or smartphone?
    – List of answers with number of responses (and percentages)

  3. Have you ever written code?
    – Pie chart of percentages + raw numbers

  4. How many years has it been since you first started writing code?
    – Pie chart of percentages + raw numbers

  5. How did you learn about Solid?
    – List of answers with number of responses (and percentages)
    – Call out quotes of “Other” answers

  6. What is your interest in Solid?
    – Try to categorize the responses into groups
    – Call out the most interesting responses as quotes

  7. How would you rate your understanding of Solid?
    – Pie chart of percentages + raw numbers

  8. How do currently you participate in the Solid community?
    – List of answers with number of responses (and percentages)
    – Bar chart?

  9. How comfortable are you contributing to GitHub repositories?
    – Bar chart

  10. How comfortable are you participating in the forums?
    – Bar chart

  11. How comfortable are you participating in the Gitter chats?
    – Bar chart

  12. How comfortable are you participating in live (virtual) Solid events?
    – Bar chart

  13. If you haven’t attended live (virtual) Solid events, what barriers prevent you from attending?
    – List of answers with number of responses (and percentages)
    – Call out quotes of “Other” answers

  14. How would you prefer to learn about news, updates and opportunities to participate in the community?
    – List of answers with number of responses (and percentages)
    – Call out quotes of “Other” answers

  15. How much do you feel you belong in the Solid community?
    – Bar chart

  16. What makes you feel like you don’t belong?
    – Try to categorize the responses into groups
    – Call out the most interesting responses as quotes

  17. What would make you feel more comfortable in this community?
    – Try to categorize the responses into groups
    – Call out the most interesting responses as quotes

  18. What changes would you like to see in this community?
    – Try to categorize the responses into groups
    – Call out the most interesting responses as quotes

  19. Any other comments?
    – Try to categorize the responses into groups
    – Call out the most interesting responses as quotes
